item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 1:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Middle-aged man trading cards go viral in rural Japan town (477 points | 96 comments)
2. Framework temporarily pausing some laptop sales in the US due to tariffs (121 points | 7 comments)
3. Show HN: Lux – A luxurious package manager for Lua (162 points | 50 comments)
4. Show HN: Browser MCP – Automate your browser using Cursor, Claude, VS Code (321 points | 121 comments)
5. Cardiac arrest deaths among marathoners have decreased, study finds (25 points | 10 comments)
6. What Was Quartz? (48 points | 16 comments)
7. Beyond Quacking: Deep Integration of Language Models and RAG into DuckDB (30 points | 4 comments)
8. Scaffold Level Editor (60 points | 11 comments)
9. Fifty Years of Open Source Software Supply Chain Security (103 points | 40 comments)
10. Hasochism: The pleasure and pain of dependently typed Haskell programming [pdf] (2013) (68 points | 10 comments)
11. 20 years of Git (201 points | 128 comments)
12. A Supermarket Bag and a Truckload of FOMO (21 points | 5 comments)
13. Decoding the 90s: Cryptography in Early Software Development (2023) (97 points | 31 comments)
14. PiDP-1, or the rebirth of an old machine (69 points | 27 comments)
15. Silicon Valley 'nepo baby' publishes scathing first novel about growing up rich (21 points | 9 comments)
16. A false X post about pausing tariffs led to multi-trillion-dollar market swings (6 points | 1 comment)
17. Rising odds asteroid that briefly threatened Earth will hit moon (6 points | 1 comment)
18. Show HN: Minimal MCP server in Go showcasing project architecture (22 points | 1 comment)
19. Rsync replaced with openrsync on macOS Sequoia (521 points | 416 comments)
20. The Troll Hole Adventure (30 points | 10 comments)
21. In the 1980s we also downloaded software from TV (18 points | 9 comments)
22. Glamorous Toolkit (295 points | 108 comments)
23. A startup doesn't need to be a unicorn (508 points | 306 comments)
24. Benchmarking LLM social skills with an elimination game (155 points | 48 comments)
25. The day I taught AI to think like a Senior Developer (4 points | discuss)
26. W.G. Sebald and the Politics of Melancholy (25 points | 3 comments)
27. Deterministic simulation testing for async Rust (89 points | 7 comments)
28. Circling the Good (24 points | 1 comment)
29. DeepMind program finds diamonds in Minecraft without being taught (225 points | 128 comments)
30. The Mathematics of Crochet (98 points | 10 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 8, 2025 at 1:20 AM UTC
